channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Taliptip folk hang on to their homes as work on Bulacan airport said to continue
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: Shirley Bacon, a resident of Barangay Taliptip in Bulakan town, said the remaining families in Sitio Kinse will continue to stand their ground and refuse to leave the waters they call home.

item.title: Nograles: Duterte not discussing charter change with Cabinet
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: "The president did not mention anything regarding charter change. It's not something that he's talked about or spoken to anyone of us about," Nograles said.

item.title: CMFR: Restrictions on access could limit SONA coverage to government narrative
item.author: Bella Perez-Rubio
item.description: The Center for Media Freedom and Responsibility on Thursday warned that the government's decision to bar media teams from entering the venue of the president's State of the Nation Address could reduce coverage of the address to state propaganda.

item.title: Makabayan lawmakers want probe into PCOO for Duterte speech edits
item.description: Fresh doubts over the presidential communications team's transparency arise just days before President Duterte is set to deliver his 2020 State of the Nation Address at the House of Representatives on Monday.

item.title: Bayanihan 2 will be certified as urgent — Palace
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte is expected to certify as urgent the bill that seeks to extend his emergency powers for pandemic response and to bankroll a stimulus package that will jumpstart the economy.

item.title: DOJ to discuss implementing rules of anti-terrorism law on Friday
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: Department of Justice officials will meet on Friday to discuss the implementing guidelines for the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020, Secretary Menardo Guevarra said.

item.title: COVID-19 cases in Philippines surpass 74K-mark with 2,200 new infections
item.description: Over 15 million people have been infected with novel coronavirus since it was first reported in China in late 2019. The disease has killed more than 620,000 people worldwide.

item.title: At least two more PCOO employees test positive for COVID-19
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: "It's good that the OPS office will open again on Monday. The problem is whether we would still have a cameraman," Roque added.

item.title: Palace: Duterte's suggestion to soak face masks in gasoline a 'joke only'
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte was just joking when he said gasoline can be used to disinfect face masks, Malacañang said yesterday, as he draws flak for the impromptu remark during a meeting of the government's pandemic task force.

item.title: Citing prejudice against their communities, Moro lawyers join fight against anti-terrorism law at SC
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: Four lawyers from the Bangsamoro region, whose continuing history is rife with struggles against terrorism, filed the 15th petition against the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020.
